page.title: 19CHANGING TIMES IN COCKFIELD
page.content: Mr.George White,who is 82 years of age came to school to talk to us about life in the village 40 years ago (1945).We asked what he remembered particularly about the year 1945 in this part of Cockfield.Of course he remembered that it was the end of the 2nd World War and that the villagers held celebrations on Mr.Hodge's meadow.300 evacuees came by train to Cockfield from London as the Germans were bombing London at that time.The evacuees were mostly children and mums.Everyone had to carry a gas- mask around in case poisonous gas bombs were dropped.All the spare land was ploughed up and crops were planted on it,because ships full of food could not get to England,as German submarines were torpedoing so many of them.When the milkman came round he used a half- pint measure.He showed us his identity card which he had carry in wartime.
